sbs.gamelogic

Class HumanBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • sbs.gamelogic.Board

  • public class HumanBoard
extends Board
    The Human player's board. Contains method for placing the ships on the board through mouse input coordinates

    • Method Detail

      • place

        public java.lang.String place(int r,
                     int c,
                     boolean isHorizontal)
        This method attempts to place a ship on the board. The method goes through a series of checks to see whether the placement is valid There are two invalid placements: either the ship goes out of board bounds, or another ship already occupies one or more cells the ship would be placed in if placement is not valid, the game prompts player to attempt again if the placement is valid, the ship is added to the ships hashmap and the next ship to be placed is one unit smaller
        Parameters:
        r - the row coordinate
        c - the column coordinate
        isHorizontal - whether the ship being placed is horizontal or vertical orientation
        Returns:
        returns a string for the GUI method calling this one so it can be added to the battle log.

      • setSize

        public void setSize(int s)
